de.lmu.ifi.mfa

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.mfa.Graph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGraph, java.io.Serializable

    class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGraph, java.io.Serializable
    The Graph class is an implementation a graph interface IGraph. It supports the following two primary functionalities: create and manipulate a graph morphology, provide auxiliary functions for maximum flow algorithms.

    The whole parameter and return values are based only on integer values as vertex identifiers. The internal data structure uses protected classes of vertices and edges.

    Furthermore, the interface provides methods to query data about the current state of the graph in order to make the graph data available.

    For additional information, see MFA project by Christian Gebhardt on Github.

    Since:
    2016-09-03
    Version:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    Christian Gebhardt

        Description copied from interface: IGraph
        Add an edge to the graph of the flow network. When the edge already exists, nothing happens.
        Specified by:
        addEdge in interface IGraph
        Parameters:
        vertexId1 - the start vertex identifier of the edge. When the vertex not already exists, it is added to the graph.
        vertexId2 - the end vertex identifier of the edge. When the vertex not already exists, it is added to the graph.
        capacity - the maximum flow capacity of the edge.
        Returns:
        true when the add operation was successful, otherwise false.

      • searchAugmentingPath

        public boolean searchAugmentingPath(int startVertexId,
                                    int endVertexId)
        Description copied from interface: IGraph
        Search an augmenting path in a graph by using a layered network. This method uses depth-first search to find an augmenting path in a flow graph. Vertices are marked as dead during the search to successively. When the search is successful, the augmenting path is stored in an auxiliary variable.
        Specified by:
        searchAugmentingPath in interface IGraph
        Parameters:
        startVertexId - the source vertex identifier from where to search an augmenting path.
        endVertexId - the sink vertex identifier,which defines the termination condition for the search.
        Returns:
        the success status, if an augmenting path was found.

      • updateMinFlowIncrement

        public int updateMinFlowIncrement()
        Description copied from interface: IGraph
        Updates the flow along an augmenting path. When an augmenting path is found and stored in an auxiliary variable, this function updates the flow along this augmenting path. It increasing the flow by the maximum allowed amount.
        Specified by:
        updateMinFlowIncrement in interface IGraph
        Returns:
        the amount of the flow increment.

      • initialPush

        public int initialPush(int startVertexId,
                       int endVertexId)
        Goldberg-Tarjan algorithm functions
        Specified by:
        initialPush in interface IGraph
        Parameters:
        startVertexId - the source vertex identifier, from where the initial push is performed.
        endVertexId - the sink vertex identifier to except the sink from the active vertices.
        Returns:
        the number of active vertices in the queue.

      • dischargeQueue

        public int dischargeQueue()
        Description copied from interface: IGraph
        Perform a discharge operation on the first vertex in the queue. This method applies push- and relabel-operations on the first active vertex. All vertices that become active during this operations are added to the rear of the queue. When the current vertex is relabeled without becoming inactive, it is also added to the rear of the queue.
        Specified by:
        dischargeQueue in interface IGraph
        Returns:
        the number of active vertices in the queue.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • graphToString

        public java.lang.String graphToString()
        Description copied from interface: IGraph
        Get the graph data in form of a text based format. This method returns a String that contains a list of all adjacent lists. Each adjacent list is represented through the edges of the form (start vertex id,end vertex id,c:capacity,f:flow)
        Specified by:
        graphToString in interface IGraph
        Returns:
        the list of all edges as integer array.

      • getGraphData

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer[]> getGraphData()
        Description copied from interface: IGraph
        Get the graph data in form of an edge list. This method returns a list of all edges as integer array. Each edge is represented through a four tuple [start vertex id, end vertex id, capacity, flow]
        Specified by:
        getGraphData in interface IGraph
        Returns:
        the list of all edges as integer array.

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> getVertexIndices()
        Description copied from interface: IGraph
        Get the graph data in form of an vertex list. This method returns a list of all vertices as integer. Each vertex is represented through its identifier as integer.
        Specified by:
        getVertexIndices in interface IGraph
        Returns:
